item.title: Marisol add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Everyone holds a piece of the truth." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Marisol add a quote by E.B. White
item.description: "If the world were merely seductive, that would be easy. If it were merely challenging, that would be no problem. But I arise in the morning torn between a desire to improve the world and a desire to enjoy the world. This makes it hard to plan the day." -- E.B. White

item.title: Marisol add a quote by Maria Montessori
item.description: "Establishing lasting peace is the work of education; all politics can do is keep us out of war." -- Maria Montessori

item.title: Marisol add a quote by Dorothy Day
item.description: "The greatest challenge of the day is: how to bring about a revolution of the heart, a revolution which has to start with each one of us?" -- Dorothy Day

item.title: Marisol add a quote by Desmond Tutu (Foreword)
item.description: "If you are neutral in situations of injustice, you have chosen the side of the oppressor. If an elephant has its foot on the tail of a mouse, and you say that you are neutral, the mouse will not appreciate your neutrality." -- Desmond Tutu (Foreword)

item.title: Marisol add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Marisol add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Marisol add a quote by Bob Marley
item.description: "Emancipate yourselves from mental slavery. None but ourselves can free our minds." -- Bob Marley

item.title: Marisol add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "There may be times when we are powerless to prevent injustice, but there must never be a time when we fail to protest." -- Elie Wiesel
